org.openadaptor.util
Class JVMNeutralMBeanServerFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.util.JVMNeutralMBeanServerFactory
public class JVMNeutralMBeanServerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to shield fact that 1.4 cannot reference java.lang.management classes. Instead of directly calling ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer(), this class uses reflections to access the ManagementFactory and similarly the method. This way it will still compile under jdk 1.4 (as long at the appropriate jmx jars are available) Otherwise the reference would break the 1.4 compilation process. Crude, but it works.

Method Detail

getMBeanServer

public static javax.management.MBeanServer getMBeanServer()
Use reflection to get an MBeanServer. Avoids compile issue where 1.4 jdk doesn't have java.lang.management.ManagementFactory 

 Note: For 1.4, an RMI registry may have to be manually started.
 This may be achieved by something similar to ...
 RJMX_LIB=oa3_lib
 JMX_LIB=oa3_lib
 CP=${RJMXLIB}/jmxremote.jar:${JMXLIB}/jmxri.jar
 export CLASSPATH=.:$CP ; rmiregistry 51410 &

 Does not apply to 1.5+

Returns:
MBeanServer instance.

shutdown

public static void shutdown()
Stops the JMXConnector server, if it's not null. Only applies to 1.4 instances.
